author: GamingBolt
description:
Revisiting Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter is easy, but capturing that same feeling – the coziness, the tension, the camaraderie, the characters, even the soundtrack – in a remake might as well be an impossible task. 

In this day and age, where remakes are dragged through the mud for either changing too much or not changing enough, how do you answer, Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter? 

Quite well, actually, striking a neat balance leaning slightly towards the latter.
title: Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter Review -  A Remake Well Worth Your Time

author: GamingBolt
description:
At its core, Endless Legend 2 not only satisfies that itch for one more turn but also for proper set-up and preparation for what future turns could hold. 

It's incrementally fulfilling and continually escalates throughout thanks to the Tidefall. Here's hoping Amplitude can supplant it further and deliver a 4X experience that truly surpasses the original.
title: Endless Legend 2 Early Access Review - Satisfies That Itch For One More Turn

author: GamingBolt
description:
Ninja Gaiden 4 feels like one of the biggest games of the year because of its energy. There's a simultaneous meeting of the old and new school with a gorgeous aesthetic and fast-paced action that knows what it wants to offer, and escalates that at a steady, pulse-pounding rate. 

It looks like a return to everything that we loved about the series, but also a big step forward, seemingly ushering in a new age. Granted, we won't truly know the franchise's future until well after its launch - success would certainly be the crescendo to this Year of the Ninja - but if nothing else, Ninja Gaiden is back, and I couldn't be more ecstatic to go hands-on.
title: You Are ABSOLUTELY NOT READY For Ninja Gaiden 4

author: GamingBolt
description:
Irrespective of whether you're a franchise veteran looking to get Kyle some payback or a newcomer wondering what all the fuss is about, these tips and tricks for Dying Light: The Beast are sure to help you get off to a good start in Techland's latest addition to its survival horror franchise. 

From combat, exploration, and a few survival tips, this guide is sure to give you a solid foundation from which you can figure out what works best for you as you keep exploring the Castor Woods.

The Beast is no walk in the park, and only an intelligent hunter can survive encounter after encounter with the Infected. Using every tool at your disposal to get ahead is the name of the game, and we're here to help you make that muscle memory as early on as you can manage.
title: Dying Light: The Beast - 15 Things It DOESN'T TELL YOU
